cards.question: What is CAE’s quality policy and where is it located?
cards.answer:
• EXE-PLCY-001 Section 2.2.10 on the PAL (be sure you are able to navigate to it AND find it)
  • Posted on the wall throughout the office (Conf 1 is an example)
  • The card on your desk (if you have one)
  • QA-MNL-001 Section 5.2 on the PAL (be sure you are able to navigate to it AND find it)
  • On the QA Page itself under “CAE QUALITY POLICY” on the top right

cards.question: Do you have an established process for ISG? Where is it located?
cards.answer: Yes – MST-PRS-051 Courseware Development Process Located on the PAL (be sure you are able to navigate to it AND find it)

cards.question: What are your roles/responsibilities as it relates to MST-PRS-051?
cards.answer: These are found in Section 1.5 Page 9 of MST-PRS-051.

cards.question: How does your department and ISG contribute to the Quality Management System?
cards.answer:
• Following processes, procedures and work instructions
  • Attention to detail/minimizing errors and waste
  • Knowing and designing to the requirements which are communicated at kickoff meetings and any questions can be deferred to a Program Manager.

cards.question: Who is the BPO (Business Process Owner)?
cards.answer:
• For MST-PRS-051: Ricky Bartlett
  • For our department procedures: the team lead.

cards.question: How often are the documents reviewed?
What are the inputs required to complete your departments responsibilities as it pertains to Courseware Production and Implementation?
cards.answer: These are found in MST-PRS-051 within each section that we have a responsibility (be sure to know how to show that)

cards.question: What is your Dept. Functional Statement?
cards.answer: This is found in the UXG SharePoint Page in the top left section.

cards.question: Who is your internal customer?
cards.answer:
It can vary but typically can include:

  • Courseware Developers
  • Project Managers
  • Tampa
  • Montreal

cards.question: Are your personal objectives defined and communicated with you?
cards.answer: Yes, through conversations and 1:1s with my team lead

cards.question: What are avenues here at ISG that are used for process improvement?
cards.answer: One Sparks, Opportunities and Risks page, PIRs

cards.question: How do we measure the effectiveness of MST-PRS-051?
cards.answer:
We measure effectiveness through:

  • Cost (are we on budget)
  • Schedule (are we on schedule)
  • Error Rates (are DRs limited)

cards.question: How do you know if the MST-PRS-051 is being effective?
cards.answer:
Through Key Performance Indicators (KPIs):

  • Cost Performance Indicator (CPI) dashboard
  • Schedule Performance Indicator (SPI) dashboard
  • Six Sigma Dashboard (we strive to maintain a 4.5 or higher sigma rating).

cards.question: How does your job contribute to the quality policy?
cards.answer:
• I follow established procedures and work instructions located on our UXG SharePoint Page under “ISG Master Documents (left side column).
  • These procedures feed into the responsibilities outlined in MST-PRS-051 (if you read the “Purpose” section of each one, you can see where it supports MST-PRS-051 specifically)
  • This work ties into the strategic business objectives the company has outlined which can be found on our UXG SharePoint Page under our Departmental Functional Statement
    • Delight Customers - Focus on Operational Excellence
    • Drive Innovation - Create Competitive Discriminators
    • Bolster Talent - Improve Employee Experience
    • Optimize Capital - Innovate for Efficiencies and Product Repeatability
